I boycotted this game for close to a year before I heard the developers were finally addressing some major community concerns with this game. In my time playing it before boycotting, the developers had made it very clear they did not care about their playerbase. Not only was the game constantly receiving bugged, half baked patches designed to simply continue the rigid update structure put forth by the devs, but the developers themselves could be caught in the majority of their public appearances speaking ignorantly about their own game, or directly attacking and insulting the playerbase. 

I am still not a fan of this developer. More so, after the absurd player outcry from the most recent update, I'm not a fan of the players of this game either. Here is a game that has invented a subgenre and has managed to keep a hold on it for over 6 years. And yet it's hard to imagine why. 

This is a horror game for the first 10 hours, tops. Then it's a strategy game for another 1 or 2 hundred. After that, it becomes a new kind of horror game. A psychological horror that exists entirely separate from the gameplay. The horror of knowing the people you see playing this game all hate you, the developers who own this game all hate you, and you start to hate them too.

This game reinvented toxicity. This game breeds the psychotic and the misanthropic. And just when this game started to get better, the community began flailing its arms, kicking and screaming at the one truly great update this game has ever received.

Every opinion around this game is a series of extremes. The asymmetrical nature of this game not only leads to polarizing power dynamics in game, but wildly opposing viewpoints around the playing and management of this game. This game should not be played competitively, and by textbook definition, rarely is. But everyone in this game is playing like they are in the world finals, and any remote inconvenience or poor luck leads to someone throwing a tantrum.

The barrier to entry to this game is absurd, and growing significantly at a quarterly rate. The amount of knowledge of deeper workings of this game required to participate in normal gameplay to the degree expected of you is tremendous. And the toll this will take on your mental health is tremendous and borderline illegal.

but its kind of fun i guess
banned for no reason support wont release any evidence they "gathered"

Dead by Daylight is a game of patience. It's an excellent game, but it requires patience. I used to think, by watching gameplay, that perks and add-ons (things that are essencial to the game, and meta matters) didn't take so long to get, and boy was I wrong.

In 68 hours of playing, I can say for sure that DBD is a really fun and competitive game, but it's a really grindy one at that. You have to like the game a lot to keep playing and learn how it works, the mechanics, the killers and the survivors along with every perk that make your life hell for both sides, but that's a competitive game for ya.

Is it worth it? It depends. If you have friends that have purchased some dlcs and can family share them with you (yes, it works), it has a lot of variety and combinations of gameplay, but if not, you'll have to grind A LOT to get free killers. But if you really want to learn the game and overall have a really good experience after learning it, yes, it's worth every penny. But be warned that it has some matchmaking issues and grinding, but it doesn't take away the fun of it.
good game, i play game and die but still fun yes. 10/10 recomended this game to yuo yes

Do you like hunting down people, living your Michael Myers or Freddy fantasy? Or do you prefer the thrill of completing tasks while the very same horrors stalk you? Then this game is the game for you! the game is premise is pretty simple, but it's still a challenging game. It's a good time!

Devs outright don't seem to be listening to the player base anymore, and community feedback is for the large part ignored. This issue seems to be getting worse over time but the state of the game seems to be almost declining as time goes instead of getting better. Until the devs really start addressing the issues plaguing the game instead of changing random things nobody ever asked for, I can't recommend getting into and spending money on this game.

Honestly, i never thought i'd enjoy this game much i primarily bought it during the holiday 2020 sale to play with a few friends but already i have had so much fun with this game. It is a great pickup.

Very unique, fun, and surprisingly balanced asymmetrical multiplayer horror game. If you have a group of mates to play with I would [i]HIGHLY[/i] recommend getting your group on this if you are all able, it is an absolute blast to play with friends. The online matchmaking is surprisingly competitive, so that could be seen as a good or a bad thing depending on who you are. The biggest flaw with the matchmaking though is that there are people who keep leaving games until they get to be the killer.
If you do that, you suck. Please stop.
Anyway, from a casual perspective this game is a blast, it's fun to play as (and run screaming from) iconic horror villains, and the game stays incredibly tense and addictively tactical the whole time. Again, give this a go with friends if you can.

When you can actually play the game, the game is very fun and exciting. The problem is that it's when you are playing the game it is super fun, but it takes 15+ minutes to find a game. When you look up about how wait times are so long, you see that this has been a problem for years, even with the game being cross platformed now.

Dead by Daylight pode parecer um joguinho f√∫til e pouco objetivo, mas ao aprofundar no universo da Entidade, voc√™ acaba descobrindo um mundo extremamente imersivo e capaz de te fazer prender por horas. Voc√™ encarna um sobrevivente lutando ou um assassino, ambos com objetivos distintos uns dos outros.
O Assassino tem o objetivo √∫nico de liquidar os sobreviventes, tendo a disposi√ß√£o uma habilidade √∫nica, nenhum assassino √© igual ao outro e com cada um voc√™ ter√° que desenvolver uma estrat√©gia singular para garantir sua vit√≥ria. J√° os sobreviventes possui o objetivo de sair do Reino da Entidade vivo, mas para isso ter√° que reparar 5 geradores e abrir um port√£o, isso tudo com um man√≠aco te perseguindo.

Very fun game and a one of a kind as well.  This game is nowhere near perfect, though. There are lots of bugs and glitches, and the load times are atrocious. There are mechanics that could ruin a game. There is nothing stopping killers from camping you and entire game, and you don't even get a chance to play. There are some fun chases you could do. This game is a blast with friends. 
If you wanna have fun with this game: ACCEPT THE BULLSH*T
I love this game!!! Can be a difficult game for beginners, but who doesn't love a great challenge.

I love Dead by Daylight, I'm not a pro never will be but I love this game so much, and plan on playing it for the rest of these couple years! However, I am gonna mention this game is very inclined to have plenty of communication between the survivors. (with no in game chat) So unless you like to rage and/or carry your team, have a premade team of goons you always play with, I recommend you play as the killer to start with. Killer is more relaxed and really easy to play, so if you're new hop in there and get killing! Both sides are so much fun, I prefer to play the survivor way more than the killer. The feeling of helplessness is very realistic and honestly it doesn't matter what you do the jump scares will get you from time to time. Plus you get the DLC characters just by playing the game a lot, and having a fun time with your pals!! So in my book, this game is worth every penny!

O jogo e interessante conta com v√°rios recursos para ajudar os sobreviventes e o assassino o que deixa o jogo divertido para se jogar com amigos e ate mesmo com desconhecidos, mas como todo jogo MP ele em certos casos se torna bem competitivo e em algumas ocasi√µes bem toxico para qualquer um dos lados mas o jogo tem uma proposta boa e vale a pena alem do mais sempre tem uma promo√ß√£o onde ele fica baratinho. <3
Gostaria de recomendar o jogo, mas a quantidade de bugs e os disconnects aleat√≥rios me impedem.

I don't like campy killers or how long you have to wait sometimes to get into a game. But at the end of it all, I'll still play it for hours and hours because it's so fun!
